text: Claude Le Tohic is a French chef and restaurateur who earned a three Michelin star rating in Las Vegas for his work at Joël Robuchon, in the MGM Grand Hotel. In 2010, he was named Best Chef: Southwest by the James Beard Foundation. In 2004, Le Tohic received the peer-juried Meilleur Ouvrier de France honor. He is the Chef/Partner behind ONE65, a six-story multi-concept culinary destination in San Francisco's Union Square, which includes ONE65 Patisserie & Boutique, ONE65 Bistro & Grill, Elements at ONE65 (a bar and lounge) and O’ by Claude Le Tohic. == Early life and education == Claude Le Tohic was born and raised in Brittany, France.Pershan, Caleb. (June 5, 2019). "Luxe French Restaurant From James Beard Award-Winner Debuts Downtown", 7x7. Retrieved February 10, 2020. He learned to cook and run a restaurant while very young, by working at his family's crêperie.Keay, Steph. (November 22, 2019). "Tout de Suite", Haute Living. Retrieved February 10, 2020. After graduating from high-school, Le Tohic pursued cooking by attending culinary school in Vannes, France. Upon graduation, he accepted an apprenticeship at Les Hortensias, a one Michelin star restaurant in Paris. == Culinary Background == Le Tohic began his career at the kitchen of Ghislaine Arabian’s Le Restaurant, a two Michelin star rated restaurant in Lille, France. In 1987, he was offered the position of Chef de Cuisine under Chef Joël Robuchon at Jamin, Chef Robuchon’s first three Michelin star rated restaurant in Paris. In 2005, Le Tohic was asked by Joël Robuchon to open Joël Robuchon restaurant and L’Atelier de Joël Robuchon, both at the MGM Grand Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas. This partnership between the two chefs featured menus which combined both chefs’ specialties and, in 2010, earned three Michelin stars. In 2019, Le Tohic opened ONE65 in San Francisco, a six-story multi-concept. ONE65 features four completely distinct designs and cuisines: ONE65 Patisserie & Boutique, ONE65 Bistro & Grill, Elements at ONE65 (a bar and lounge), and O’ by Claude Le Tohic.Phillips, Justin. (June 6, 2019). "San Francisco French dining hub One65 brings $250 tasting menus to Union Square", San Francisco Chronicle". Retrieved February 11, 2020. == Awards and Honors == * Meilleur Ouvrier de France, 2004 * James Beard Foundation Winner, Best Chefs in America 2010. * Michelin Guide three-star rating == References == Category:1968 births Category:Living people Category:People from Brittany Category:French chefs
title: Claude Le Tohic
